abstract: Gwen Ifill, trailblazing journalist who covered White House, Congress and national political campaign over three decades for variety of news organizations, most prominently PBS, dies at age 61; Ifill, black woman at vanguard of profession dominated by white men, led distinguished career that culminated in her co-anchoring first all-female anchor team on network nightly news, with Judy Woodruff, on PBS NewsHour.

headline.print_headline: Gwen Ifill, Groundbreaking Reporter, Dies at 61
headline.main: Gwen Ifill, Political Reporter and Co-Anchor of ‘PBS NewsHour,’ Dies at 61

snippet: Ms. Ifill reported for The Washington Post, The New York Times and NBC News before becoming a PBS presence and debate moderator....
lead_paragraph: Ms. Ifill reported for The Washington Post, The New York Times and NBC News before becoming a PBS presence and debate moderator.
